review_title: Energetic scale-up with great people and culture
pros:
Excellent culture, really focused on progress and on continuing to build in this crypto winter. Inspiring founders, new senior leadership hires are impressive. 
This pros of startup without the politics thanks to information transparency and very approachable managers.
cons: Cake is evolving from startup to scaleup so some processes don't exist or need to be built out. For me this is also a good thing because you can take up responsibility and make proposals which are always appreciated.

review_title: Common mission that's fulfilling and great teammates
pros:
Talented and collaborative teammates.
Leads do not micromanage.
Product-driven with strong collaboration with devs.
Clear team principles to abide by.
Fun work culture, minimal politics.
Clear short to medium term goals.
Super diverse team.
Get paid in BTC!
cons:
Product management is new, thus a lot of product debt. Expect to compromise a lot.
Long term goals are a bit uncertain.
Mobile app engineers are not particularly strong in UI implementation. Designers spend energy creating beautiful mockups only to see half-assed implementations. We need UI devs with a penchant for details.
Things move so fast, there's no time to do proper formative research. Everything feels like it's based on the gut feeling of the higher ups.
Slight disconnect between Marketing and Product.

review_title: A great place to work at built around 7 team principles which the founders and colleagues live by
pros:
1. Highly passionate and forward thinking founders who care immensely about the company culture even as we grow at a breakneck pace

2. Friendly and highly motivated team members and colleagues who are passionate about what we're doing and always willing to share their knowledge

3. Great company benefits so we can focus on what we do and deliver optimal results
cons: Being a young start-up, there are a lot of processes that still need to be refined before it can become a well-oiled engine that matches larger more established companies. But at the rate we are growing, it is expected, and they are addressing this.

pros:

- The choice to work remotely as of this moment

- Performance reviews can be a bit intense and it feels like we should constantly be performing at our best condition, can be stressful at times
- There seems to be a slight disconnect between the engineering team vs the business team, interests need to be aligned. With that said, there is no perfect team

review_title: Purposeful and energetic team culture, exciting crypto startup
pros: The culture is what really drew me into this company and has kept me going thus far. It's fun, driven and everyone truly believes in what the company is trying to achieve in the DeFi crypto space. Leadership takes time to understand what each employee wants to achieve, and provides the support and tools they need to succeed. Compared to my past experiences in law firms and financial institutions, this company stands out as the most exciting venture that I have ever been a part of.
cons: Startups dictate that you come in having a game plan and knowing what to do from the get go. You will thrive here if you do not expect much hand holding and are confident in making independent decisions.

review_title: A tech-startup with an actual business
pros:
Ownership. You own your job, your career, your hours, your holidays. Do your job, do it well, and it will take you as far as you want it to.

Fantastic culture. People here work hard because they want to, and because they see the value their work brings. This leads to a very good energy in the team, where people more often than not are willing to help each other out.

Visibility. Everyone's work is important, visible, and impactful.
cons:
You cannot remain stagnant, because others will nudge you forward with them. It's not for everyone.

Visibility. Nowhere to hide if that's a thing.

review_title: Fast growth, aggressive results, high work load
pros:
The company is extremely fast growing.
The goals are very high.
Culture is fantastic with a combo of remote and on-site work.
Leadership is strong and dedicated.
Very smart people.
cons:
I left in 2020 due to personal reasons. The work load is really high. Everyone is fully committed, but it is long hours.
Salary is fair, but not extremely high as for some other tech companies.
Work at Cake if you enjoy working on something exciting and meaningful, but be ready to put in way more hours than at most other companies.
